hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is

to a new economic system let's get into
the economic collapse financial news now
we know that the NAFTA negotiations
while that is continuing it's ongoing
and Trump is out there and he's warning
that he might scrap the entire North
American Free Trade Agreement which is
NAFTA with Mexico and Canada saying that
you know if the sides can't compromise
on this twenty-three-year-old deal then
we're gonna have to get rid of it he
finally came out and said listen
personally I don't think we can make a
deal I think we'll probably end up
terminating NAFTA at some point and he's
saying that you know this might not even
work out now when he was running for the
presidency he said NAFTA was a
completely bad deal now he is a
businessman he knows what deals how
deals are made he knows if they're good
or bad and I think he needs to go back
to his roots and I think he needs to
take a really deep look and I know
there's a lot of pressure from outside

lot of pressure from everywhere but he
needs to go back to his roots of what
he's been saying during the campaign to

now I looked at the deal and it is awful
it did not help America I mean he gave

scrap it and come up with something

well only time will tell we don't know
right now we see the negotiations going
on but what we do know is if they don't
come up with any type of deal and he
doesn't scrap this this won't help the
economy whatsoever because we see the
economy it is completely falling apart
and we're seeing every single sector
well it's imploding new home sales
crashed in July
that it came down nine points 4%
month-on-month
now they thought and I'm talking about
the financial pundits the government
they thought that this was going to be a
pretty darn good month and a
year-over-year it was an eight point
nine percent plunge this is the worst
since 2014 and where are we today well
we are nowhere the housing market has
been bouncing up and down around the
zero percent mark we average it all out
it is gone absolutely nowhere it is dead
now think about it we have higher
mortgage rates we have stagnant wages
people are losing their jobs and the
housing prices in these 20 cities are

how are people going to purchase houses
well it's not the American people its
Chinese investors hedge funds investment
companies we also need to remember that

back in 2007 we are now below that point
which tells us we are bordering on this
collapse now we are definitely in a

know the government the Fed they're not

recession started in 2016 2017 or the

interesting institutional risk analyst
Chris Whelan well he's looking at the

coming while he's saying winter is here
for housing and what he's saying is that
we are in trouble the big picture on
housing reflected in the mainstream
media is one of
caution home valuations are one of the
clearest indicators of inflation in the
US economy
in fact since World War two home prices
in the US have gone up four times the
official inflation rate now houses
weren't always this expensive go back to
1940 the median home value in the US was
in 1980 it was 47,000 by 2000 it was a
hundred and nineteen thousand and here
we are today in 2018 and it's even above

what we are seeing right now is
